content: 14 16 18 stitches on each needle join in the round carefully making sure you don t twist any stitches cuff k2 p2 for 15 rounds or longer if you like a longer cuff there s no right or wrong here leg of the sock all sizes round 1 *k3 p1* repeat for all 28 32 36 stitches on n1 and n2 k all 28 32 36 stitches on n3 and n4 repeat round 1 until you reach your desired leg length you can knit knee socks ankle socks or somewhere in between just be sure you have enough yarn you should be able to knit 2 adult medium knee socks with 115 g of fingering weight yarn now you re ready to start on the heel portion of the sock there are many different types of heels you can knit for a sock i find the following traditional heel flap and gusset the best fit for my family but feel free to substitute any other heel you like the heel flap and heel turn are worked flat in other words not in the round heel flap set up knit across the n1 and n2 in the rib pattern k3 p1 these will be the front of the sock or instep and these stitches will not be worked again until after the heel flap and heel turn are finished heel flap for the heel flap and heel turn you will only be working with the 28 32 36 stitches that are now on n3 and n4 in row 1 you will be working all stitches from both n3 and n4 onto n3 therefore combining those 28 32 36 stitches onto one needle for the heel flap and heel turn n1 and n2 are now the front instep of the sock and n3 will hold the 28 32 36 stitches from n3 and n4 row 1 rs *s1 knit wise k1* to end row 2 ws turn work around so now the purl side of n3 is facing you s1 purl wise p to end turn work row 3 rs *s1 knit wise k1* to end turn work row 4 ws s1 purl wise p to end turn work repeat row 3 and 4 above 12 14 16 more times for a total of 28 32 36 row you will be ending with a purl row turn your work you will start the heel turn with a knit row 3 © the kitchen sink shop for the heel turn you will be working short row all this really means is that you will be working only some of the stitches on a row and then turning your work and continuing with the next row this is what shapes the curve of the heel turn heel turn the heel turn continues only with the stitches on n3 row 1 rs k 16 19 21 ssk k1 turn work row 2 ws s1 purl wise p 5 7 7 p2tog p1 turn work
